title: Angular impulse - cylinder and sphere tau-t graphs

content.prompt: The two graphs show the net torque exerted on two rotating objects, a cylinder, and a sphere, as a function of time. If both objects are initially rotating in the positive direction, taken to be counterclockwise, for which object does the angular momentum decrease in magnitude during the time interval shown? What reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: The cylinder. The slope of the graph is negative.
The cylinder. The torque has the same sign as the cylinder’s angular velocity.
The sphere. The slope of the graph decreases in magnitude as time increases.
The sphere. The torque has the opposite sign to the sphere’s angular velocity.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
